Which sharing setting would allow users to collaborate with their peers who work for the same partner firm, but not with any users outside of their firm?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B

B. Portal User Visibility

Setting the visibility to "Portal User Visibility" ensures that users can collaborate within their partner firm while restricting visibility to users outside of their firm. This setting is appropriate for a Partner Community where collaboration among users within the same partner firm is desired while maintaining privacy from users outside of the firm.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is looking to onboard three new partners to the community.
Each partner should have a branded experience containing their colors and logo.
Gold and Silver partners should have access to the Leads Inbox component, but Bronze partners should not.
Bronze partners should not have access to the Leads tab.
How should an administrator solve for these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Create branding sets, audience targeting, and navigation menu targeting.

By creating branding sets, each partner can have a branded experience with their colors and logo. Audience targeting allows for specific components or pages to be displayed based on the user's profile or criteria. In this case, Gold and Silver partners can be targeted to have access to the Leads Inbox component, while Bronze partners can be excluded. Navigation menu targeting enables different navigation menus to be displayed based on the user's profile or criteria, ensuring that Bronze partners do not have access to the Leads tab. This approach provides the necessary customization and access control for each partner within a single community instance.

Which limitation could cause a potential issue for UC?

choices.C: Customer Service template does not allow downloading documents out-of-the-box.
choices.D: Customer Community Plus license does not allow access to custom objects.
choices.A: Customer Service template does not allow record pages for custom objects out-of-the-box.
choices.B: Customer Community Plus license allows only up to 2 million users per org.

questions.question_text:
As a pilot, Ursa Major Solar’s customers from California were assigned to a page variation for the Home page so that the layout looks slightly different than for customers from other states. The page variation uses a Rich Content Editor component assigned solely to Platinum customers.
Who will be able to view the Content Editor component?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. All Platinum customers from California

Since the Rich Content Editor component is assigned solely to Platinum customers, only those customers who have the Platinum status will be able to view it. Additionally, since the page variation is specific to customers from California, only Platinum customers from California will see the Content Editor component on the Home page.

choices.D: Create a Share Group for a Customer Community profile that is not associated with a Sharing Set.
choices.A: Create an owner-based sharing rule to share records owned by a Customer Community role with all internal users.
choices.C: Use the standard Is Owned By External User checkbox on records to create a criteria-based sharing rule to share records owned by Customer Community users with all internal users.
choices.B: Create a Sharing Set that includes a Customer Community profile and create a Share Group for the Sharing Set.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Create a Sharing Set that includes a Customer Community profile and create a Share Group for the Sharing Set.

By creating a Sharing Set that includes the Customer Community profile and then creating a Share Group for that Sharing Set, records owned by Customer Community users can be shared with internal users. This configuration allows for controlled sharing of records between external and internal users based on specific criteria defined in the Sharing Set.
